author: Pat Anthony
title: Commuting by bike in Charlotte to improve health and save money
text:
Play For the people that don’t enjoy the gym, their commute may be the saving grace they need to improve their fitness. WSJ’s Rachel Bachman joins Lunch Break. Photo: Getty on.aol.com A number of people in the Charlotte area own bikes and commute to work by bike rather than using their car. This not only could be a health benefit, but also is a considerable savings for some. The exact number of those in Charlotte now commuting by bike is not known at this time.
Those who have not tried commuting to work by bike in Charlotte might not be aware of parking for the area. This might be the first thing most workers would check to be sure their bicycle will be safe while they work. Some employers are adding spaces specifically for those commuting by bicycle.
In some areas of the United States commuting by bike is more common. Many large cities have a considerable amount of commuters using bikes as their main transportation. The amount of bike commuters will no doubt increase in time.
For those hoping to burn a few calories by biking to work, the amount burned will vary. Depending on the road conditions and the size of the person peddling, a considerable amount of weight could be lost this way. There are several sites that will help determine how many calories could actually be burned in this manner.
Riding a bike a considerable distance on a regular basis also helps to build certain muscles and increase stamina. Learning which muscles will gain the most benefit and how cycling helps a person lose weight is discussed on several sites . Some commuters are riding a bike to work just a few days each month. This often seems to be enough to make a considerable difference in persons health .
